metadata.title: CVE-2017-5058 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
A use after free in PrintPreview in Google Chrome prior to 58.0.3029.81 forWindows allowed a remote attacker to potentially perform out of boundsmemory access via a crafted HTML page.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-5058` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 58.0.3029.81-0ubuntu2.1350
chromium-browser-l10n - 58.0.3029.81-0ubuntu2.1350
chromium-chromedriver - 58.0.3029.81-0ubuntu2.1350
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 58.0.3029.81-0ubuntu2.1350
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 58.0.3029.81-0ubuntu2.1350
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '58.0.3029.81-0ubuntu2.1350').
